bestBHT.bht: Our Lord reacts with polite disappointment to the host's lack of attention and forgiveness. He highlights the contrast between the woman's extravagant act of love and the host's neglect, emphasizing the evidence of forgiveness shown by the woman through anointing His feet with costly ointment. While the host fails to anoint Jesus' head with ordinary oil, the woman goes above and beyond, anointing His feet with precious ointment and expressing her deep gratitude in this remarkable way.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: What evidence was thus afforded of any feeling which forgiveness prompts?"
Our Lord speaks this with delicate politeness, as if hurt at these inattentions of His host.
The inference is plain—only one of the debtors was really forgiven.
Albert Barnes: The custom of pouring oil upon the head was universal among the Jews.
She had applied to his feet a far more precious and valuable unguent. He therefore, showed comparatively little love. She showed much.
Marvin Vincent: Thou didst not anoint my head, the nobler part, with ordinary oil.
She hath anointed my feet with costly ointment.
She hath anointed my feet with costly ointment.
Philip Schaff: The host failed to supply oil for the head.
The woman not only gave the more precious ointment.
The woman... herself applied it to His feet.
Archibald T. Robertson: With ointment (μυρω). Instrumental case. She used the costly ointment even for the feet of Jesus.
John Gill: Mine head with oil thou didst not anoint,.... No not with common oil, so usually done at feasts" (Luke 7:46).
There is, throughout the whole account, an opposition between the conduct of Simon, and this woman" (Luke 7:46).
He did not so much as anoint his head with common oil when she anointed his feet with costly ointment brought in an alabaster box" (Luke 7:46).

bhtAttempts.bht: In Luke 7:46, our Lord speaks with delicate politeness, as if hurt by the inattentions of His host. He highlights the evidence of forgiveness that the woman has shown through anointing His feet with costly ointment, contrasting it with Simon's failure to even anoint His head with common oil. The host's lack of hospitality is contrasted with the woman's extravagant act of love, revealing her great depth of feeling and gratitude. The woman goes above and beyond, not only giving the more precious ointment but also applying it with her own hands to Jesus' feet.

In this passage, there is a clear contrast between the host's indifference and the woman's extravagant act of love. Our Lord expresses disappointment at the host's lack of forgiveness and hospitality, highlighting the evidence of forgiveness the woman exhibits through anointing His feet with costly ointment. While the host fails to even anoint Jesus' head with common oil, the woman goes above and beyond, demonstrating her deep gratitude by anointing His feet with precious ointment that she applies with her own hands.

Our Lord reacts with polite disappointment to the host's lack of attention and forgiveness. He highlights the contrast between the woman's extravagant act of love and the host's neglect, emphasizing the evidence of forgiveness shown by the woman through anointing His feet with costly ointment. While the host fails to anoint Jesus' head with ordinary oil, the woman goes above and beyond, anointing His feet with precious ointment and expressing her deep gratitude in this remarkable way.

Our Lord expresses disappointment at the host's inattentions, emphasizing the evidence of forgiveness shown by the woman through anointing His feet with costly ointment. He points out the contrast, stating that the host failed to anoint His head with ordinary oil. In contrast, the woman goes beyond ordinary measures and anoints His feet with precious ointment. This act of love and gratitude reveals the magnitude of her forgiveness. The host's lack of hospitality is starkly contrasted with the woman's extravagant gesture.

He highlights the contrast, stating that the host failed to anoint His head with ordinary oil. In contrast, the woman goes beyond ordinary measures and anoints His feet with precious ointment. This act of love and gratitude reveals the magnitude of her forgiveness. The host's lack of hospitality is starkly contrasted with the woman's extravagant gesture.
